intro: Marmoritis, commonly known as the marble plant, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, mottled leaves that resemble marble patterns, giving it its common name. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Marmoritis is typically grown as a houseplant due to its preference for warm, humid environments.
